Name: Tell me about a time you took ownership of a broken system
Action: Instrumented SLIs/SLOs; created incident taxonomy; fixed top 2 root causes; added alerts + runbook; partnered with PM to tradeoff tech debt sprint.
Company Hook (examples): Amazon: Ownership + Dive Deep; Microsoft: customer obsessed + growth mindset.
Ethics/Integrity Check: Call out customer impact first; avoid blame.
How to Answer if Probed: Be ready with: what you stopped doing, what you automated, what you measured.
Notes: Strong if you show prevention, not heroics.
Result: Incidents down; MTTR improved; roadmap stabilized.
Task: Stop the churn without slowing roadmap.

Name: Tell me about a time you made an unpopular decision
Action: Presented risk matrix; proposed reversible alternative; ran a time-boxed experiment; communicated decision transparently; committed to execution.
Company Hook (examples): Amazon: Have Backbone; Atlassian: open company, no bullshit.
Ethics/Integrity Check: Avoid 'because I said so'; show data and empathy.
How to Answer if Probed: Quantify the downside avoided; show you listened.
Notes: End with what you learned about influencing.
Result: Outcome improved; team later adopted the decision framework.
Situation: Team wanted {quick fix} that risked long-term cost.
Task: Choose the right tradeoff under time pressure.

Name: Tell me about a time you handled an ethical dilemma
Action: Raised concern; documented risk; proposed compliant alternative; involved security/legal when needed; ensured no retaliation for raising issue.
Company Hook (examples): Uber: do the right thing; Microsoft: integrity/accountability.
Ethics/Integrity Check: State the principle clearly; do not be vague.
How to Answer if Probed: Explain escalation path and how you protected users.
Notes: Keep details sanitized; focus on decision framework.
Result: Correct approach adopted; trust increased; no compliance risk.
Situation: Found a shortcut that could inflate metrics or violate policy.

Name: Tell me about a time you mentored someone to success
Action: Set weekly goals; paired on tasks; gave specific feedback; created safe space; gradually increased ownership; celebrated progress.
How to Answer if Probed: Share what you changed in your style based on their needs.
Notes: Highlight their growth, not your heroism.
Result: They shipped independently; team throughput improved.
Situation: A teammate struggled with {skill} and confidence.
Task: Help them level up while meeting delivery needs.

Name: Cross-functional conflict (Eng vs Product vs Design)
Action: Unified success metric; wrote PRD-lite; facilitated tradeoff workshop; defined MVP; tracked decisions in a single doc.
Company Hook (examples): Atlassian: play as a team + customer; Amazon: Earn Trust.
Ethics/Integrity Check: Avoid 'PM was wrong'; focus on alignment.
How to Answer if Probed: Be ready with stakeholder map + how you communicated progress.
Notes: Show that you can translate between functions.
Result: Alignment reached; shipped MVP; reduced churn.
Task: Align stakeholders on goals and constraints.

Name: Tell me about a time you improved a process (not just code)
Action: Introduced review SLA + templates; added CI checks; reduced flaky tests; created dashboard; ran retros.
Company Hook (examples): Amazon: Invent and Simplify; Atlassian: be the change.
How to Answer if Probed: Provide before/after numbers and rollout strategy.
Result: Cycle time down; quality stable or improved.
Situation: PR reviews or deploys were slow and inconsistent.

Name: Handling incomplete data (decision with uncertainty)
Action: Defined leading indicators; shipped feature flag; ran A/B with stop criteria; monitored; rolled forward or back.
Company Hook (examples): Google: structured experimentation; Amazon: Dive Deep.
How to Answer if Probed: Explain how you chose metrics and sample size logic.
Notes: Say what would change your mind.
Situation: Needed to choose between {Option A/B} without perfect data.
Task: Make a reversible decision with guardrails.

Name: Tell me about a time you raised the bar on quality
Action: Added property-based tests for core logic; improved code review checklist; introduced canary + rollback automation.
Company Hook (examples): Amazon: Insist on Highest Standards; Microsoft: customer obsessed.
How to Answer if Probed: Share one example of a bug class eliminated.
Situation: Bugs/edge cases kept escaping to production.

Name: Tell me about a time you dealt with underperformance
Action: Clarified expectations; agreed on a support plan; provided specific feedback; reduced scope; paired; escalated only if no improvement.
Company Hook (examples): Microsoft: care + accountability; Atlassian: open but kind.
How to Answer if Probed: Be ready with how you documented and avoided bias.
Result: Either performance improved or transition handled professionally.
Task: Improve outcome while respecting the person.

Name: Tell me about a time you recovered from a major setback
Action: Postmortem; restarted with smaller milestone; aligned stakeholders; shipped incremental wins; communicated transparently.
How to Answer if Probed: Explain what you changed in planning and risk management.
Result: Delivered value; regained trust; learned repeatable playbook.
Situation: Project failed initial launch or was deprioritized.
